message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the shared characteristics of birds, snakes, sharks, and people. The common characteristic among these organisms mentioned is that they all defecate. Option (B) is incorrect because eating beans is not a characteristic shared by all of these organisms. Option (C) is incorrect because praying is a behavior specific to humans and some other animals, but not all of the organisms mentioned. Option (D) is incorrect because laying eggs is a characteristic specific to birds and reptiles, but not sharks or people.

This question requires some knowledge about common characteristics among different animals. The thing that is shared between birds, people, snakes, and sharks is that they all defecate. Defecation is a normal bodily function in animals to eliminate waste. Option (B) is incorrect because eating beans is specific to certain animals or human dietary choices and not common to all the listed animals. Option (C) is incorrect because praying is a human religious practice and not related to the other animals. Option (D) is incorrect because not all the listed animals lay eggs - only birds and snakes lay eggs, while people and sharks do not.

All living organisms excrete waste, and defecation is the process by which waste is eliminated from the body. Option (B) is incorrect because eating beans is not a characteristic shared by all these organisms. Option (C) is incorrect because praying is a human religious practice and not a shared characteristic. Option (D) is incorrect because not all of these organisms lay eggs.
